Cellar.synopsis: the priestess reacts to seeing the player when they've either escaped her clutches or trespessed in her private chapel
Cellar.how_to_trigger: teleport S_GOB_GoblinPriestSpeak with True Soul Gutask for help, follow her into chapel, speak with her againtake potionroll amazing to escape from chains

ChainedCharacter.synopsis: Players wake from a sleeping spell/potion to find themselves chained, captive, in a cellar. The last thing they remember is accepting help from the goblin priestess, who has now captured them. She is sadistic and takes great pleasure in explaining that they're going to become mindflayers due to the parasite in their head, and that she's going to keep them trapped here until that happens.Barbarian characters can break free at the end if they succeed a strength check. Combat with Gut ensues.
ChainedCharacter.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game (not as a Drow).2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 298.109; 36.973; -164. Talk to Priestess Gut > accept the brand > accept her help with the tadpole > follow her > talk to her again and say yes.5. Let her rummage into your brain > tell her to get it out > i'm ready.6. Drink the potion.

Chapel.synopsis:
The goblin priestess is branding new converts to the cult of the Absolute. She is a True Soul - tadpoled, but unaware that is the case. She believes she is communing directly with the Absolute.

She's one of three leaders in the goblin camp, and an important and powerful member of the Absolute's cult. She's charismatic and friendly, in a crude sort of way, but has an underlying suspicion and curiosity. Her offers of help are really a ploy to separate players from their friends so that she can imprison them and watch as the parasite eats them alive.

Dead.synopsis: Players cast a spell allowing them to speak to the corpse of the goblin priestess, a high-ranking religious figure in the goblin camp
Dead.how_to_trigger: - loadlevel WLD_Main_A- goto 298; -16- Kill Priestess Gut (ctrl+shift+k)- Use Speak with Dead on her corpse (ReCon: addDebugSpell Target_SpeakWithDead; InfiniteAp)

Branding.synopsis:
The sadistic goblin priestess is branding new converts to the cult of the Absolute. She is a True Soul - tadpoled, but unaware that is the case. She believes she is communing directly with the Absolute.

 She's one of three leaders in the goblin camp, and an important and powerful member of the Absolute's cult. She's cruel and has a sense of superiority over her own kind. Her offers of help are really a ploy to separate players from their friends so that she can imprison them and watch as the parasite eats them alive.

Chains.synopsis: Character is interacting with the priestess' chains.

Cellar_0.speaker: True Soul Gut
Cellar_0.text: What are you doing in here?
Cellar_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Not chained character tries to talk to the priest while he is in his roomNodeContext: startled, angry

Cellar_1.speaker: True Soul Gut
Cellar_1.text: I'm gonna split your head open!

Cellar_2.speaker: True Soul Gut
Cellar_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Not chained character tries to talk to the priest while he is in his roomNodeContext: startled, angry

Cellar_6.speaker: True Soul Gut
Cellar_6.text: I'm gonna split your head open!

Cellar_3.speaker: True Soul Gut
Cellar_3.text: How'd you escape? I'll chop you to messes!

Cellar_4.speaker: True Soul Gut
Cellar_4.text: Careful - there's monsters on the loose. And I ain't talking about worgs and ogres.

ChainedCharacter_35.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_35.text: Wakey wakey. Don't bother strugglin' - you ain't goin' nowhere.
ChainedCharacter_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallInternalNodeContext: Character was kidnapped and chained by priestNodeContext: malicious - she pretended to be our friend and now she's chained us to a wall. Should be a real change in tone from everyhing before this branch - true nature revealed, and it's not pretty

ChainedCharacter_27.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_27.text: You might think you're in charge - but you ain't a drow anymore. Yer a flesh-puppet.
ChainedCharacter_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: Malicious glee at having the upper-hand

ChainedCharacter_37.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_37.text: The Absolute wants to know all about that critter in your head. So start talkin'!
ChainedCharacter_37.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: malicious; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_31.speaker: Player
ChainedCharacter_31.text: I was abducted... A mind flayer infected me with this thing.

ChainedCharacter_21.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_21.text: I know that much. I saw the whole horrible story in your memories.
ChainedCharacter_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: malicious and excited; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_15.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_15.text: And I know what happens next. Your teeth fall out, your skin rips off, and you turn into one of them.

ChainedCharacter_55.speaker: Player
ChainedCharacter_55.text: You're out of luck. I don't know any more about it than you do.

ChainedCharacter_36.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_36.text: Liar! We've both seen the monster that put it there. And I know what happens next.
ChainedCharacter_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: malicious and excited; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_1.speaker: Player
ChainedCharacter_1.text: I'll make you pay for this, goblin.

ChainedCharacter_39.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wall - hits them in the faceNodeContext: Angry, slaps the player in the face, yelling on first sentence, malicious and excited; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_20.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_20.text: Can't beat you too hard, though. Got to keep you alive for what comes next.

ChainedCharacter_22.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_22.text: If I set you free, you'll be sucking out my brains as soon as I turn my back.
ChainedCharacter_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: too smart to fall for our tricks; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_19.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_19.text: That creature's turning your brain into broth, boiling away your memories.
ChainedCharacter_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: malicious and excited, describing the horrors to come; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_10.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_10.text: Do you even know who you are anymore?
ChainedCharacter_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: malicious; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_11.speaker: Player
ChainedCharacter_11.text: I have... powers. Something's changing in me.

ChainedCharacter_29.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_29.text: Powers? No. They're delusions. That thing's eating your brain.
ChainedCharacter_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: malicious and excited, describing the horrors to come; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_17.speaker: Player
ChainedCharacter_17.text: I know I'm going to kill you. How about that?

ChainedCharacter_33.speaker: Player
ChainedCharacter_33.text: I am the Demonsbane, champion of Avernus. You don't frighten me.

ChainedCharacter_13.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_13.text: It's not me you need to be frightened of - it's what that thing in your head is gonna do to you.

ChainedCharacter_5.speaker: Player
ChainedCharacter_5.text: I am Lae'zel. And I have slaughtered the likes of you ten times over.

ChainedCharacter_51.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_51.text: You ain't gonna lay a finger on me. You're finished.
ChainedCharacter_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: malicious; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_38.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_38.text: And I don't have to do nothing but wait. That thing inside your head is gonna eat your brain from the inside out.
ChainedCharacter_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: malicious and excited, describing the horrors to come; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_59.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_59.text: And eventually your skull will split and you'll cough up a mess of tentacles.
ChainedCharacter_59.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: malicious and excited, describing the horrors to come; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_50.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_50.text: Stop it? Why would I wanna do that?
ChainedCharacter_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: malicious; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_56.speaker: Player
ChainedCharacter_56.text: No, I'm not going to let that happen.

ChainedCharacter_8.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_8.text: Think you're special, do you? You're not.
ChainedCharacter_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: malicious; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_48.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_48.text: I'm gonna keep you here so I can see every gory detail, and hear every whimper and scream.
ChainedCharacter_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: malicious and excited, describing the horrors to come; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_53.speaker: Player
ChainedCharacter_53.text: If I do transform, you'll be my first meal.

ChainedCharacter_60.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_60.text: Not likely. You're forgetting one thing - I've got the Absolute to protect me.
ChainedCharacter_60.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: gloating; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_30.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_30.text: But you? You're on your own. Nothing more than a skin-suit for that monster inside you.
ChainedCharacter_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: malicious; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player breaks free from their chains and stands before Gut

ChainedCharacter_54.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_54.text: Wha...? No! Some one c'mere and help me - NOW!
ChainedCharacter_54.context: InternalNodeContext: Combat ensuesNodeContext: Incredulous, frantic. The player just burst free of their restraints before her eyes, (Combat ensues)

ChainedCharacter_42.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_42.text: Oh look how they struggle! Don't do yourself a mischief, now.
ChainedCharacter_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player struggles against their chains, to little effect. Priestess Gut chuckles with amusement.NodeContext: First sentence spoken with an amused chuckle. 'Oh you silly thing'

ChainedCharacter_9.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_9.text: You're so adorable when you're angry, pet. Pity those looks'll be torn open before long. Ah well...
ChainedCharacter_9.context: NodeContext: Creepy affection. 'Ah well' said with an airy 'c’est la vie' tone.

ChainedCharacter_61.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_61.text: You're gonna be my new pet. A ferocious squiddie, all for myself.
ChainedCharacter_61.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: malicious; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_64.speaker: Player
ChainedCharacter_64.text: You're infected. The same thing will happen to you.

ChainedCharacter_32.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_32.text: Lies! I'm stronger than ever. And I've got the Absolute on my side.
ChainedCharacter_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: gloating; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_18.speaker: Player
ChainedCharacter_18.text: You won't live to see it, trust me.

ChainedCharacter_58.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_58.text: You might have put up a fight in another life, freak. But not in this one.
ChainedCharacter_58.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: malicious; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_0.speaker: Player
ChainedCharacter_0.text: I am the Blade of Frontiers. You don't frighten me.

ChainedCharacter_45.speaker: Player
ChainedCharacter_45.text: The prophet of the end, the armageddon-watcher. You are nothing.

ChainedCharacter_26.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_26.text: Maybe that's wot the creature wants you to think.
ChainedCharacter_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: malicious; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_63.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_63.text: It's gonna start eating your flesh, too. Changing you.
ChainedCharacter_63.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: malicious and excited, describing the horrors to come; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_62.speaker: Player
ChainedCharacter_62.text: Weren't you supposed to be helping me?

ChainedCharacter_24.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_24.text: It's too late to help you. It already was.
ChainedCharacter_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: mocking, malicious; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_28.speaker: Player
ChainedCharacter_28.text: You're infected. It's going to happen to you, too.

ChainedCharacter_7.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_7.text: Stop trying to confuse me. You're a liar.
ChainedCharacter_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wall - hits them in the faceNodeContext: Angry, slaps the player in the face, yelling on first sentence, malicious and excited; has the player chained and captive

ChainedCharacter_49.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter_49.text: Everything's clear since the Absolute chose me. You're the one that's broken.
ChainedCharacter_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallNodeContext: trying to convince herself; a bit confused; has the player chained and captive

Chapel_92.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_92.text: Smart. All you need to do is open yourself to the Absolute, and I'll do the rest.
Chapel_92.context: NodeContext: slightly more sinister than her friendlier nodes - we don't know what "the rest" is but it doesn't sound great; in actuality, she's tricking us into imprisonment and possible death

Chapel_6.speaker: Narrator
Chapel_6.text: *Psionic feelers creep across your mind, like a pickpocket's fingers seeking flaws in fabric.*
Chapel_6.context: NodeContext: describing the creepy sensation of being telepathically explored by a goblin

Chapel_190.speaker: Player
Chapel_190.text: Seal your mind against the intrusion.

Chapel_88.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_88.text: It's all slippery in there. What are you hiding?
Chapel_88.context: NodeContext: describing a psionic intrusion, but can sound like she's a surgeon talking about digging through our guts

Chapel_24.speaker: Player
Chapel_24.text: Relax your mind, directing her to the memory of your infection.

Chapel_36.speaker: Narrator
Chapel_36.text: *An image of the mind flayer reaches out to her from your memories.*

Chapel_135.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_135.text: This ain't right. Why are you resisting me if you're one with the Absolute?

Chapel_28.speaker: Narrator
Chapel_28.text: *You repel her mental probes, concealing your memories.*
Chapel_28.context: NodeContext: successfully repelling an psionic intruder

Chapel_109.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_109.text: There's something wicked burrowed in your brain. I can't get a grip on it. Best start praying for help.
Chapel_109.context: NodeContext: frustrated, failed to help us

Chapel_47.speaker: Narrator
Chapel_47.text: *She prises your mental barriers apart... and sees the mind flayer from the ship.*

Chapel_51.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_51.text: Hells. That is horrible. Can see why you'd want to keep it secret.
Chapel_51.context: NodeContext: very shocked, just saw something HORRIBLE in our memories

Chapel_171.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_171.text: But there's no secrets between us, True Soul. Lemme take a look and find out what it did to you.

Chapel_162.speaker: Player
Chapel_162.text: Allow her to rummage through your memories.

Chapel_73.speaker: Narrator
Chapel_73.text: *Sifting deeper, she sees the mind flayer holding a wriggling tadpole to your eye.*
Chapel_73.context: NodeContext: afraid, describing a horrible memory

Chapel_74.speaker: Narrator
Chapel_74.text: *And then the vision lurches, and you are looking through her eyes as a tadpole squirms into her skull.*
Chapel_74.context: NodeContext: describing a psionic vision - some shock on the beat about seeing through "her eyes".

Chapel_82.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_82.text: Hells. We need to fish that thing out before it eats any important parts of your brain.

Chapel_64.speaker: Player
Chapel_64.text: Then get it out of me.

Chapel_7.speaker: Player
Chapel_7.text: Eh, most of my brain is a wreck. Just do what you will.

Chapel_27.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_27.text: Don't you worry. I've got everythin' I need to fix you. Might get a bit messy though.
Chapel_27.context: NodeContext: reassuring us, like a doctor to a patient

Chapel_80.speaker: Player
Chapel_80.text: Give me a little time to prepare.

Chapel_2.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_2.text: Time's the one thing you don't have. We've gotta get this thing out now.
Chapel_2.context: NodeContext: concerned, with a hint of menace on the last sentence

Chapel_177.speaker: Player
Chapel_177.text: What exactly does your plan involve?

Chapel_151.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_151.text: It involves you puttin' yer trust in the Absolute. Simple.
Chapel_151.context: NodeContext: matter of fact - it's all about faith

Chapel_53.speaker: Player
Chapel_53.text: I don't think so. Time to die.

Chapel_68.speaker: Player
Chapel_68.text: I still have my senses. I'll find another way to deal with it.

Chapel_39.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_39.text: No. You ain't leaving until we get to the bottom of this. You could be dangerous.
Chapel_39.context: NodeContext: concerned, with a hint of menace on the last sentence

Chapel_184.speaker: Player
Chapel_184.text: Do whatever you have to. Just get rid of it.

Chapel_170.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_170.context: NodeContext: pleased that we've accepted her help (we really will regret this and that can be hinted at in how pleased she is)

Chapel_95.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_95.text: Being a True Soul, you know the Absolute don't like to touch nothin' unclean.
Chapel_95.context: CinematicNodeContext: Show potion?NodeContext: tentative, selling us a lie and hoping to get away with it

Chapel_42.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_42.text: So drink this. It'll purify ya.
Chapel_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: offering a potionNodeContext: offering a potion; lying, but fairly convincing

Chapel_130.speaker: Narrator
Chapel_130.text: *You recognise tell-tale flecks of werejackal blood - it's a potion of sleep.*

Chapel_5.speaker: Player
Chapel_5.text: That'll put me to sleep - are you trying to trick me?

Chapel_34.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_34.text: I ain't deceiving nobody. I'm tryin' to help!

Chapel_70.speaker: Player
Chapel_70.text: I don't think so. You're finished.

Chapel_142.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_142.text: This could have gone easy for you. Not now, though. I'll tear you to shreds!
Chapel_142.context: NodeContext: malicious, like a mob boss who just had an offer turned down

Chapel_146.speaker: Narrator
Chapel_146.text: *The potion is poisoned, but your virtuous resolve is stronger than the toxins.*
Chapel_146.context: CinematicNodeContext: Paladin smiles triumphantly as their eyes light up with flame of virtue. Priestess Gut reacts with fear.

Chapel_66.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_66.text: Sweet dreams. I'll see your ugly mug on the other side.
Chapel_66.context: CinematicNodeContext: getting up close as we fall to sleep from the potion we just drankNodeContext: malicious, speaking softly and close to the player as they fall asleep

Chapel_189.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_189.text: I guess we're doing this the hard way, then.
Chapel_189.context: NodeContext: preparing to cast a hostile spell on us

Chapel_100.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spell CastNodeContext: malicious, just put us to sleep with a spell

Chapel_26.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_26.text: It's a liquid blessing. It'll cleanse you - and it tastes better than the rotgut at the party.

Chapel_52.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_52.text: Hang on - somebody's nabbed my potion.
Chapel_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: patting down her pocketsNodeContext: patting down her pockets - dismayed

Chapel_8.speaker: Player
Chapel_8.text: Let me show you just how dangerous I am, True Soul.

Chapel_168.speaker: Player
Chapel_168.text: I'm a prodigious murderer, and I'm going to treat you to my brilliance.

Chapel_123.speaker: Player
Chapel_123.text: One of those things is inside you too, you know.

Chapel_71.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_71.text: No. It's messing with your brain. You're seeing things - probably hearing voices too, yeah?
Chapel_71.context: NodeContext: patient and patronising - like a gross goblin doctor trying to calm a hysterical patient

Chapel_20.speaker: Player
Chapel_20.text: Pretty sure one of those parasites is squirming in your head, too.

Chapel_23.speaker: Player
Chapel_23.text: I've heard enough - time to die.

Chapel_78.speaker: Player
Chapel_78.text: What exactly are you going to do?

Chapel_46.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_46.text: Whatever the Absolute tells me to. Don't worry - She loves you. I can tell.
Chapel_46.context: NodeContext: responding to us asking what her plan is - the Absolute is her god. The plan is in god's hands

Chapel_127.speaker: Player
Chapel_127.text: Change of plan. I'm going to kill you.

Chapel_101.speaker: Player
Chapel_101.text: I'm ready to destroy your hold over this cult. Are you ready to die?

Chapel_37.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_37.text: Ready to figure out what's going on with those shadows in your head?

Chapel_121.speaker: Player
Chapel_121.text: I already know what causes them - a creature in my brain.

Chapel_60.speaker: Player
Chapel_60.text: I'm ready to kill you, actually.

Chapel_49.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_49.text: I can't fix what's wrong with you. Best pray to the Absolute for help.
Chapel_49.context: NodeContext: Confused, slightly irritated with herself

Chapel_55.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_55.text: Surprised to see you still standing. You ready to figure out what that critter's doing to your head?

Chapel_72.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_72.text: You wanted to talk privately, so here we are. What's botherin' you?

Chapel_138.speaker: Player
Chapel_138.text: Those shadows you saw? There's a creature inside my brain.

Chapel_13.speaker: Player
Chapel_13.text: I've been searching for a healer - can you help?

Chapel_17.speaker: Player
Chapel_17.text: I needed a quiet corner to slaughter you in.

Chapel_85.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_85.text: The Absolute will protect me - you don't stand a chance.

Chapel_96.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_96.text: Only those that have faith are welcome here. Clear off before I cut you.

Chapel_143.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_143.text: Let's get your head fixed once and for all.

Chapel_193.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_193.text: Don't want a crowd of gawpers. Everybody else needs to leave.

Chapel_50.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_50.text: Don't want anyone peepin' on private matters, so...
Chapel_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spell castInternalNodeContext: Priest will try to close door to the chapel here using cantripNodeContext: preparing to close a door for privacy

Chapel_158.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_158.text: Can't get any privacy around here...
Chapel_158.context: InternalNodeContext: It's impossible to close the doorNodeContext: mildly annoyed

Chapel_103.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_103.text: There we go. Secret and safe. Well... secret.
Chapel_103.context: InternalNodeContext: It's possible to close the door, priest is in process of closingNodeContext: just closed a door - amused on last line

Chapel_155.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_155.text: Only those that have faith are welcome here. Clear off before I cut you.

Chapel_165.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_165.text: One of your mates asked to talk in private, so here we are. What's botherin' you?

Chapel_182.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_182.text: Another special visitor. You've been touched by the Absolute, haven't you?
Chapel_182.context: NodeContext: part carnival-barker, part-priestess. She's revelling in her role at the centre of a public religious conversion ceremony that involves branding the flesh of initiates

Chapel_179.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_179.text: Priestess Gut needs to touch you, too. Hold out your arm so I can mark you.
Chapel_179.context: NodeContext: a sly insult in most case: the 'especially' lines are respectful. The others are jokes at the player's expense, but a friendly kind of insult

Chapel_32.speaker: Lae'zel
Chapel_32.text: Enough stalling. Finish her, and be quick about it.

Chapel_9.speaker: Shadowheart
Chapel_9.text: None of her friends around... Perfect time for a little discreet knifework.

Chapel_35.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_35.text: Lets the faithful recognise one another quick-sharp. That way, nobody'll mess with you.
Chapel_35.context: NodeContext: explaining a magical brand in a friendly way

Chapel_111.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_111.text: And it's charged with magic. Ordinary slobs can't see it; only us that follow the Absolute.
Chapel_111.context: NodeContext: explaining a magical brand in a friendly way

Chapel_57.speaker: Narrator
Chapel_57.text: *As the pain muddles your thoughts, your minds become entangled. A familiar sensation - she, too, carries a parasite.*
Chapel_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: She applies the branding iron to the player's hand, leaving behind the mark of the Absolute, glowing. After a beat, it fades.|NodeContext: internal dialogue as the player reacts to both the 'pain' from a branding iron applied (voluntarily) to their hand, and a goblin priestess exploring their mind telepathically

Chapel_112.speaker: Narrator
Chapel_112.text: *Her faith floods into you - a tide of shuddering ecstasy. Her tadpole nestles within that mania, secure... hidden.*
Chapel_112.context: NodeContext: feeling a goblin priestess' faith - it is overpowering. And behind it, a creepy discovery - a parasitic tadpole, the same as the player carries in their own mind

Chapel_140.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_140.text: You pokin' around in my mush?
Chapel_140.context: NodeContext: 'mush' being brain/head - we've just psionically communicated with her and she's amused

Chapel_139.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_139.text: Works both ways, mate. An' I saw some weird shadows swimmin' around in your head just now.
Chapel_139.context: NodeContext: 'works both ways' being a psionic connection. Disturbed by the weird shadows

Chapel_44.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_44.text: I already said I'd help your mate, but I'll fix you one at a time, right here in the chapel. Send 'em through.
Chapel_44.context: NodeContext: trying to convince us that everything's above board, and that we're all on the same team.

Chapel_41.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_41.text: Maybe I can help with that... Didn't realise you were a True Soul.
Chapel_41.context: NodeContext: pondering - impressed that we are True Souls (high-ranking members of her religion)

Chapel_154.speaker: Player
Chapel_154.text: I've been looking for a healer - can you help?

Chapel_175.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_175.text: You've come to the right place.

Chapel_176.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_176.text: With the Absolute's will, I can fix anything.

Chapel_97.speaker: Player
Chapel_97.text: There's a creature inside my head. Can you do anything about that?

Chapel_75.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_75.text: A creature? There's definitely something rotten in there.
Chapel_75.context: NodeContext: surprise and awe - she's horrified but also VERY intrigued

Chapel_163.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_163.text: Let me take a closer look. I ain't seen anything like this before.
Chapel_163.context: NodeContext: mispronunciation of 'intervention' is intentional. Trying to calm us

Chapel_136.speaker: Player
Chapel_136.text: I'm pretty sure you're infected, too.

Chapel_145.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_145.text: Eh? Ain't nothin' wrong with me. You're the one who's sick in the head.
Chapel_145.context: NodeContext: bristling with irritation, and accusatory but still treating us as an ally

Chapel_185.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_185.context: NodeContext: suspicious and curious, but still trusts us for now

Chapel_40.speaker: Player
Chapel_40.text: At this point, I'll take anything. Do what you can.

Chapel_94.speaker: Player
Chapel_94.text: You can help me by dying quietly.

Chapel_54.speaker: Narrator
Chapel_54.text: *Your minds brush against one another but are swiftly parted.*
Chapel_54.context: NodeContext: deliberately thwarting a goblin's attempts to read our mind

Chapel_195.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_195.text: What are you hiding in there? There's some weird shadows swimming around.
Chapel_195.context: NodeContext: 'get intimate' referring to a psionic connection rather than a physical one; disturbed by the shadows

Chapel_0.speaker: Player
Chapel_0.text: I'm not letting you burn my flesh.

Chapel_83.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_83.text: Maybe you don't need me to. After all, you're special, ain't you? Like me.

Chapel_157.speaker: Narrator
Chapel_157.text: *She probes your mind, tangling your thoughts with hers. A familiar sensation - she, too, carries a parasite.*

Chapel_63.speaker: True Soul Gut
Chapel_63.text: You can't! The Absolute will crush you!

Chapel_77.speaker: Karlach
Chapel_77.text: If we're quick about it, we can cut her throat before she calls for reinforcements.

Chapel_125.speaker: Astarion
Chapel_125.text: There's no one here. Can we please kill her and get on with our day?

Chapel_29.speaker: Wyll
Chapel_29.text: Weapon at the ready - now's the time.

Dead_4.speaker: Player
Dead_4.text: Where do you keep your valuables?

Dead_1.speaker: Narrator
Dead_1.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Dead_7.speaker: Narrator
Dead_7.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Dead_9.speaker: Narrator
Dead_9.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

Branding_14.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_14.text: Now, here's somebody special. The Absolute has touched you, hasn't She?
Branding_14.context: NodeContext: part carnival-barker, part-priestess. She's revelling in her role at the centre of a public religious conversion ceremony that involves branding the flesh of initiates

Branding_54.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_54.text: Priestess Gut needs to touch you, too - hold out your arm so I can mark your flesh.
Branding_54.context: NodeContext: a sly insult in most case: the 'especially' lines are respectful. The others are jokes at the player's expense, but a friendly kind of insult

Branding_10.speaker: Wyll
Branding_10.text: A priestess. One of the leaders, no doubt about it. Let's make her squeal.

Branding_71.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_71.text: What's that? Tell your friend to keep quiet, or he'll lose his good eye.

Branding_88.speaker: Player
Branding_88.text: Ignore him. Tell me about the mark, priestess.

Branding_2.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_2.text: Ready for the fire, are you?

Branding_99.speaker: Player
Branding_99.text: Nod to Wyll and prepare to attack.

Branding_23.speaker: Lae'zel
Branding_23.text: One of the leaders. Split her skull and be done with it.

Branding_0.speaker: Player
Branding_0.text: Why should I let you brand me?

Branding_21.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_21.text: Lets the faithful recognise one another quick-sharp. That way, nobody'll mess with you.
Branding_21.context: NodeContext: explaining a magical brand in a friendly way

Branding_52.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_52.text: An' it's charged with magic. Ordinary slobs can't see it; only us that follow the Absolute.
Branding_52.context: NodeContext: explaining a magical brand in a friendly way

Branding_66.speaker: Gale
Branding_66.text: Charged with magic? Perhaps that explains the ease with which these goblins submit to True Souls.

Branding_97.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_97.text: You ready? Brace yourself - this'll sting.

Branding_92.speaker: Player
Branding_92.text: I doubt that, but go ahead.

Branding_34.speaker: Player
Branding_34.text: I have always wanted to smell my own burning flesh.

Branding_49.speaker: Narrator
Branding_49.text: *As the pain muddles your thoughts, your minds become entangled. A familiar sensation - she, too, carries a parasite.*
Branding_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: She applies the branding iron to the player's hand, leaving behind the mark of the Absolute, glowing. After a beat, it fades.|NodeContext: internal dialogue as the player reacts to both the 'pain' from a branding iron applied (voluntarily) to their hand, and a goblin priestess exploring their mind telepathically

Branding_103.speaker: Narrator
Branding_103.text: *Darkness seems to swallow the temple, leaving you with a vision of the goblin priestess, receiving instruction from a handsome young man. One of the Chosen...*
Branding_103.context: InternalNodeContext: Narrator nodes are temporary until assets are available for cinematic nodes

Branding_60.speaker: Narrator
Branding_60.text: *The vision dissolves away. You stand before the goblin priestess in the temple once again.*

Branding_18.speaker: Narrator
Branding_18.text: *Her faith floods into you - a tide of shuddering ecstasy. Her tadpole nestles within that mania, secure... hidden.*
Branding_18.context: NodeContext: feeling a goblin priestess' faith - it is overpowering. And behind it, a creepy discovery - a parasitic tadpole, the same as the player carries in their own mind

Branding_51.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_51.text: I feel you in there, digging around.
Branding_51.context: NodeContext: 'mush' being brain/head - we've just psionically communicated with her and she's amused

Branding_74.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_74.text: Works both ways. And I saw some weird shadows swimming around in your head just now.
Branding_74.context: NodeContext: 'works both ways' being a psionic connection. Disturbed by the weird shadows

Branding_87.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_87.text: Maybe I can help with that. Us True Souls got to look out for one another.
Branding_87.context: NodeContext: pondering - impressed that we are True Souls (high-ranking members of her religion)

Branding_28.speaker: Player
Branding_28.text: Do you think you can fix whatever's causing those shadows?

Branding_79.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_79.text: With the Absolute's will, I can fix anythin'.

Branding_83.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_83.text: Let's deal with this in my chapel. It's private. Don't want this lot interfering with True Soul business.
Branding_83.context: NodeContext: leading us away to her private chapel; speaking quietly as if discussing secret plans

Branding_67.speaker: Player
Branding_67.text: There's a creature inside my head. Can you help with that?

Branding_27.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_27.text: A creature? There's definitely something rotten in there.
Branding_27.context: NodeContext: surprise and awe - she's horrified but also VERY intrigued

Branding_89.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_89.text: Let me take a closer look. I ain't seen anything like this before.

Branding_24.speaker: Player
Branding_24.text: I'm pretty sure you're infected, too.

Branding_7.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_7.text: Eh? Ain't nothin' wrong with me. You're the one who's sick in the head.
Branding_7.context: NodeContext: bristling with irritation, and accusatory but still treating us as an ally

Branding_36.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_36.context: NodeContext: suspicious and curious, but still trusts us for now

Branding_68.speaker: Player
Branding_68.text: You'll never see anything like it again - time to die.

Branding_63.speaker: Player
Branding_63.text: Any help would be appreciated. I need a healer.

Branding_47.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_47.text: You've come to the right place.

Branding_29.speaker: Player
Branding_29.text: Can we talk privately? This is a sensitive matter.

Branding_32.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_32.text: Of course. Don't want this rabble interfering with True Soul business. Let's go to my chapel.

Branding_78.speaker: Player
Branding_78.text: As if I'd trust a creature like you to meddle in my mind. Time to die, True Soul.

Branding_82.speaker: Narrator
Branding_82.text: *Your minds brush against one another but are swiftly parted.*
Branding_82.context: NodeContext: deliberately thwarting a goblin's attempts to read our mind

Branding_64.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_64.text: Don't wanna get intimate in front of the novices? Fair enough. Got some weird shadows in your head.
Branding_64.context: NodeContext: 'get intimate' referring to a psionic connection rather than a physical one; disturbed by the shadows

Branding_73.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_73.text: Already spoke to one of your mates - a True Soul, just like you. Said I'd help them, and that goes for you as well.
Branding_73.context: NodeContext: trying to convince us that everything's above board, and that we're all on the same team.

Branding_76.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player sees a brief vision of Priestess Gut standing before Gortash in a TBD vision settingInternalNodeContext: Cinematics blocked due to lack of assets for Gortash. Narrator nodes until assets available

Branding_42.speaker: Player
Branding_42.text: Actually, I'd rather not go through with this.

Branding_102.speaker: Player
Branding_102.text: I assume this mark has a purpose.

Branding_9.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_9.text: Shows our devotion to the Absolute. These maggots see how strong we are with Her guidance.
Branding_9.context: NodeContext: proud, explaining her flock's devotion

Branding_105.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_105.text: Whole camp'll be branded soon. An' you should be, too.

Branding_108.speaker: Player
Branding_108.text: I'm not letting you burn me for life on a whim.

Branding_5.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_5.text: Maybe you don't need it. After all, you're special, ain't you? Like me.

Branding_16.speaker: Narrator
Branding_16.text: *She probes your mind, tangling your thoughts with hers. A familiar sensation - she, too, carries a parasite.*

Branding_30.speaker: Player
Branding_30.text: I'm here to spill your guts across the floor.

Branding_44.speaker: Lae'zel
Branding_44.text: Yes - give in to your bloodlust.

Branding_77.speaker: Shadowheart
Branding_77.text: That's a bigger fight than we needed to pick - not the subtlest of assassins, are you?

Branding_22.speaker: Karlach
Branding_22.text: We're fighting the whole tribe at once? Subtle. Next time, let me do the talking.

Branding_11.speaker: Astarion
Branding_11.text: Yes! And I thought you weren't any fun.
Branding_11.context: NodeContext: Excited, slightly feral "yes!" as Astarion starts to let the animal out.

Branding_45.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_45.text: You think you can hurt me? This'll be good!

Branding_48.speaker: Wyll
Branding_48.text: You want to fight all of them? So be it - I have your back.

Branding_80.speaker: Gale
Branding_80.text: Whoa! There are a lot of guts to go around in this place. Are you sure you...? Never mind. Too late.

Branding_20.speaker: Player
Branding_20.text: I serve only my oath, I will not bear your brand.

Branding_15.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_15.text: Ready to figure out what's goin' on with those shadows in your head?

Branding_91.speaker: Player
Branding_91.text: I know what's wrong - there's a creature inside my brain.

Branding_13.speaker: Player
Branding_13.text: I've been looking for a healer. Think you can help?

Branding_101.speaker: Player
Branding_101.text: No, but by my oath, I am ready to take your head.

Branding_35.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_35.text: I only deal with those what have faith. Clear off.

Branding_39.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_39.text: Good to see you still standing. Ready to figure out what that critter in your head is doing?

Branding_53.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding_53.text: Still lookin' to get yer head fixed? Best ask the Absolute for help - I can't figure it out.
Branding_53.context: NodeContext: Confused, slightly irritated with herself

Chains_14.speaker: Narrator
Chains_14.text: *You test the weight of the chains, looking for weak points.*
Chains_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player chained with their arms behind, they're attached to a stone post

Chains_13.speaker: Player
Chains_13.text: Dislocate your wrist and wriggle free.

Chains_2.speaker: Player
Chains_2.text: Dislocate your wrist and wriggle free.

Chains_4.speaker: Narrator
Chains_4.text: *A sharp pain shoots through your arm as the bone pops out of place. The chains hold tight.*

Chains_7.speaker: Player
Chains_7.text: Tense your muscles, straining against the chains.

Chains_11.speaker: Narrator
Chains_11.text: *The chains snap as you expand your chest.*

Chains_5.speaker: Narrator
Chains_5.text: *Your muscles burn with the effort, but the chains hold strong.*

Chains_15.speaker: Narrator
Chains_15.text: *You've tried everything - the chains still hold you.*
Chains_15.context: InternalNodeContext: Player failed skill checks and decided to leave the chains alone.
